titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Villanova University traces its origins to old Saint Augustine's Church in Philadelphia, which the Augustinians founded in 1796, and to its parish school, Saint Augustine's Academy, established in 1811. Villanova University has been sponsored by the Augustinian Order since its founding in 1842. Today, the University is comprised of five colleges: Liberal Arts and Sciences (Villanova College), Engineering, School of Business (formerly known as the College of Commerce and Finance), Nursing and the School of Law.

scopecontent.p: The Publications record group consists of the following series: Athletics, University Communications, Student Life, University Information Technology, Registrar, NROTC, and Library. Materials include: University catalogues, bulletins, and schedules; student and faculty directories; program and department catalogues, brochures, handbooks, and newsletters; athletics media guides; faculty newsletters; press releases; alumni newsletters; University annual reports; and yearbooks (1922-2008).

controlaccess.corpname: Villanova University. Naval Reserve Officer Training Corps.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
